WorkItem.Description:
in this file if you check the executioner box for optimization, the optimizer will always choose to use it and lower your dps, you will get higher dps if you optimize with executioner unchecked
Â 
recreate by checking or unchecking the executioner box and optimizing

Comments.Message: Would help if you noted what model you were talking about, so that the dozens of different model devs don't have to all download it to see if it's theirs or not.
sorry, it's the cat model, i didn't think about that

Ah, looks like it's Cat.
First of all, as the warning you get when you start the Optimizer says, you've got a *ton* of different items/gems/enchants selected, for almost every slot, which slows down and lowers the typical accuracy of the Optimizer. Try to limit what you mark available to only what has a remote chance of being useful (especially gems, since that increases the number of options exponentially).

When I optimize that character, it does not choose Executioner. Almost certainly, your issue was just that you gave the optimizer a slew of different options, and/or used a low thoroughness. The optimizer's results aren't guaranteed; give it fewer choices, and more time, in order to get more accuracy.

Looks like the biggest problem with that character file was the gems; you had a huge number of useless gems enabled (+AP gems? As a Cat?). Just disabling the obviously terrible gems helped the Optimizer out a whole lot.

what do you mean "help out"
i used the highest thoroughness and i just checked every option for this file
i took out the worthless stuff and it still optimizes with executioner for less dps?

'helped out' = made it alot more accurate and consistent. Reread both of my responses, as well as the Gear Optimization help topic. The more possible choices the optimizer has, the less accurate and consistent it is. Therefore, you should only mark things available if they have a chance of being useful. ie, +32ap gems are utterly useless to a Cat, when there are +16str gems available.

OK, please, try again. Read what I've said here, and read the text on the Optimizer screen, and the help topic for it.

You *WILL* sometimes get sub-optimal results with the Optimizer. It is *NOT* guaranteed. There is randomness-involved (that's how the Optimizer works). Help the Optimizer out by narrowing its search, and using a high thoroughness.
you should add a "generate best possible gearset" option :P

"you should add a "generate best possible gearset" option :P"
What does that mean? Clarify, please?
it's supposed to make you laugh
